title: Lmao
body:
So I was trying to update to the new client so I could use the sandbox mode but I seem to be unable to download it. Whenever I go to launch it I don't get this pop-up that is supposed to appear so I click this https://gyazo.com/708258e518e98b058f517e90dcb8ac80 

And this pops up

https://gyazo.com/342d6f0f37174efef70f8b2b13fb1a3e

Which only has information on the practice tool ^
I have searched through the website for the download and maybe I missed it or something. I only found the download for the legacy client which seems to bugsplat every time I launch it now. (I fixed it by doing something like this https://gyazo.com/414c4bf57710c7b54dc294fbec2d50af ) Which brings it to the legacy client from which I do get a pop-up for a download for the beta (Which I haven't gotten in months) When I click on that it brings me to a page where it just uninstalls the whole game...

I do not know if I am missing something or maybe I should just wait until they release it completely in 12 months.  
 -Sincerely,
               me

replies.body:
There might be some confusion with the directory and the client thinking you might already have the updated client installed.  Try the following steps to help.

- Navigate to your League of Legends installation folder. (Typically C:\Riot Games\League of Legends
- Scroll down until you find "LeagueClient.exe" and delete the file.
- Open the client by right clicking on "lol.launcher.admin.exe" and click on "Run as administrator"
- Repair the client by selecting the “?” button in the top right-hand corner of the Patcher window (the first window that appears) and under the options menu, select Repair.

Let me know if it works for you!
